newsitem.title: INDIA: Gates says Windows NT version "probably" in 1998.
newsitem.headline: Gates says Windows NT version "probably" in 1998.

text.p: Microsoft Corp chairman Bill Gates said on Tuesday that the next version of Windows NT networking software would probably be launched in 1998.
"Actually we have not given a date. It would probably be in 1998," Gates said in response to a question at a news conference in New Delhi during a visit to India that began on Monday.
He added that there was no commitment on the date of the release, which would depend on feedback from customers on its trial versions.
"NT 5.0 is such a major step forward that people are quite anxious to see us get it out there," Gates said.
On February 28 a report on the Computer Reseller News Web site said Microsoft Corp officials had informed a core group of developers that Windows NT 5.0 will not ship until the first quarter of 1998.

The publication said at a nondisclosure briefing Microsoft operating systems experts told a group of about 50 developers that the initial beta for Windows NT 5.0 will not be ready until late this summer, at the earliest.
The final versions of Windows NT Workstation and Server 5.0 are now slated for early next year, rather than late 1997, as Microsoft had said previously, officials said.
